body:
We've been discussing internally on this, and most likely will come up with a new API for the same, to prevent inconsistent usage of Application Name from exploiting telemetry data.

We're drafting out API structure and will share details soon for review.

issue.title: Feature: New API to capture Client Information for telemetry

labels.name: Enhancement :bulb:
labels.description: Issues that are feature requests for the drivers we maintain.

labels.name: Triage Done :heavy_check_mark:
labels.description: Issues that are triaged by dev team and are in investigation.

labels.name: P2
labels.description: Use to label moderate priority issue - impacts atleast more than 1 customer.

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

repository.name: SqlClient
repository.description: Microsoft.Data.SqlClient provides database connectivity to SQL Server for .NET applications.

issue.body: With reference to request coming from EF Core team (https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/issues/35730), opening this issue for tracking feature introduction in the SqlClient repo.

issue.title: Inject Application Name to SQL Server connection string when not set

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Note: this support via the connection string is temporary and is likely to go away in EF 11 once SqlClient introduce a more first-class user-agent-like mechanism (see https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/issues/35730#issuecomment-3012092136).

Closes #35730
